verses.roman:
bhagavān api tad vīkṣya
go-kulaṁ bhaya-vidrutam
mā bhaiṣṭeti girāśvāsya
vṛṣāsuram upāhvayat

synonyms: bhagavān—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; api—indeed; tat—that; vīkṣya—seeing; go-kulam—the cowherd community; bhaya—out of fear; vidrutam—made to flee, or distraught; mā bhaiṣṭa—"don't be afraid"; iti—thus; girā—with words; āśvāsya—pacifying; vṛṣa-asuram—to the bull demon; upāhvayat—He called out.
translation: When the Supreme Lord saw the cowherd community distraught and fleeing in fear, He calmed them, saying, "Don't be afraid." Then He called out to the bull demon as follows.
